column4: Can somebody help me removing Gaim? Even after doing a complete remove in Synaptic, Gaim is still in my Applications menu and works.
did that too. according to Synaptic Gaim is totally gone.
have you previously installed it manually from source or with third party packages?
then that'll be where it's coming from, go back to your source tree and do "sudo make uninstall"
things compiled by hand do not interact with synaptic/apt-get, so they won't know anything about them
how do i know my source tree?
by that I mean the directory you unpacked and did "./configure" and "make" in.
I'm afraid I've deleted that the moment the installation was successful.
oh well, you'll have to find and remove all the gaim files by hand then
try not to compile things from source unless you have to - it's a major pain ;)
I'm discovering that now. :(  How can I find all the files? the search function won't let me search elsewhere than my home directory
that gave me a huge list of things. But maybe I'm better doing what Frogzoo said: redownload and then 'make uninstall'
it might work, but you may well have to build it first
do you remember if you passed a --prefix option to the ./configure script?
I'll try, if not I will remove what I got with the locate command. Thank you for helping me.
